biweekly.io.chain

Class ChainingTextWriter

  • java.lang.Object
    • biweekly.io.chain.ChainingTextWriter

  • public class ChainingTextWriter
extends Object
    Chainer class for writing traditional, plain-text iCalendar objects.
    Author:
    Michael Angstadt
    See Also:
    Biweekly.write(Collection), Biweekly.write(ICalendar...)

    • Method Detail

      • version

        public ChainingTextWriter version(ICalVersion version)

        Sets the version that all the iCalendar objects will be marshalled to. The version that is attached to each individual ICalendar object will be ignored.

        If no version is passed into this method, the writer will look at the version attached to each individual ICalendar object and marshal it to that version. And if a ICalendar object has no version attached to it, then it will be marshalled to version 2.0.

        Parameters:
        version - the version to marshal the iCalendar objects to
        Returns:
        this

      • caretEncoding

        public ChainingTextWriter caretEncoding(boolean enable)
        Sets whether the writer will use circumflex accent encoding for parameter values (disabled by default). This only applies to version 2.0 iCalendar objects.
        Parameters:
        enable - true to use circumflex accent encoding, false not to
        Returns:
        this
        See Also:
        ICalWriter.setCaretEncodingEnabled(boolean), RFC 6868

      • tz

        public ChainingTextWriter tz(TimeZone defaultTimeZone)
        Sets the timezone to use when outputting date values (defaults to UTC).
        Parameters:
        defaultTimeZone - the default timezone
        Returns:
        this

      • go

        public void go(File file)
        throws IOException
        Writes the iCalendar objects to a file. If the file exists, it will be overwritten.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to write to
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem writing to the file

      • go

        public void go(File file,
      boolean append)
        throws IOException
        Writes the iCalendar objects to a file.
        Parameters:
        file - the file to write to
        append - true to append onto the end of the file, false to overwrite it
        Throws:
        IOException - if there's a problem writing to the file
